Articles.Content:
[http://www.dorkly.com/post/73102/mission-to-mars](http://www.dorkly.com/post/73102/mission-to-mars)

Didn't want any of you to miss this ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)
Ha ha! That's awesome! The world *shall* respect us! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Lol, made me laugh.
I was kinda expecting NASA asking KSP forums whats wrong with their designs and mission plans, but still good enough.

The expressions on the faces of the kerbals is priceless! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Like: "lolwhut? what's their problem?!" ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> I was kinda expecting NASA asking KSP forums whats wrong with their designs and mission plans, but still good enough.

NASA: We have a problem with this craft. Wondering if you all could help us out. 

KSP Forum: Have you tried adding more boosters?

> 
> NASA: We have a problem with this craft. Wondering if you all could help us out. 
> KSP Forum: Have you tried adding more boosters?

Nah, needs more struts. Or the CoL is shifting ahead of the CoM

Moar boosters!

Moar struts!

Pointy end towards space!

Whats actually funny is that, if the educational KSP game element that i think is also being made is eventually used by students who become employees of NASA, then your statement about kerbals teaching NASA how to fly rockets into space is actually true.

I did like the comic though.

Come on, astronauts; what are you afraid of? We're pretty sure that test flight 122 is going to work!

P.S. our testing program has run out of funding, so YOU are test flight 122.
Brilliant
Hey! My Kerbals rarely die ... this is not a true representation! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I always wondered if KSP isn't some sort of social experiment and NASA is actually cround-sourcing designs from us "players"

Im watching you NASA ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

Awesome. ...

Test 121 heh ? Sounds about right. Took me forever to get my heavy lifter in order. To think about it, I've not used it since 0.24.2, I guess more explosions incoming lol !
That's great!! thanks for sharing. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> I always wondered if KSP isn't some sort of social experiment and NASA is actually cround-sourcing designs from us "players"
> Im watching you NASA ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

I'm with you.

I'm going to start building rockets that blow up all the time, just to mess with them!

Ok... now I just need to... do.. nothing different.

![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> I'm with you.
> I'm going to start building rockets that blow up all the time, just to mess with them!
> 
> Ok... now I just need to... do.. nothing different.
> 
> ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Perhaps if you took off the gloves...

embedding for easy access 

![d6e0a5aa89a19fcfc2cb59e1cca5ad14.jpg](http://0.media.dorkly.cvcdn.com/89/70/d6e0a5aa89a19fcfc2cb59e1cca5ad14.jpg)

![79fc77d80030b5555ccf0b7d3eb786ae.jpg](http://0.media.dorkly.cvcdn.com/58/64/79fc77d80030b5555ccf0b7d3eb786ae.jpg)

![e0ae8ac0110bad00d858da6fab0578c3.jpg](http://2.media.dorkly.cvcdn.com/85/88/e0ae8ac0110bad00d858da6fab0578c3.jpg)

![3f2fa12788e191fea233eb326661f28d.jpg](http://1.media.dorkly.cvcdn.com/44/94/3f2fa12788e191fea233eb326661f28d.jpg)

![94b15a9d1a79da90c39df5fba9a01ee6.jpg](http://1.media.dorkly.cvcdn.com/57/75/94b15a9d1a79da90c39df5fba9a01ee6.jpg)
"Test flight 121 failed" should be in Spanish...

> 
> "Test flight 121 failed" should be in Spanish...

And backwards. 

I could rant about how this adds to the perception that kerbals are poor designers, but it is only the astronauts who were worried. Kerbals have a bit of an advantage when it comes to putting crew at risk, which humans don't...

Considering that Kerbals have access to uber-powerful ion engine, functional nuclear engine, an RTG producing energy indefinitely? NASA should learn from little green men ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) And explosions are awesome.

> 
> Considering that Kerbals have access to uber-powerful ion engine, functional nuclear engine, an RTG producing energy indefinitely?

Don't forget those reaction wheels that never saturate. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Kerbals live by McQuack's Maxim: "Any crash you can walk away from counts as a landing."

> 
> Don't forget those reaction wheels that never saturate. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Also solar panels that have a semi-linear fall-off, and transfer pumps and pipes that can handle an unlimited flow volume for zero power.

> 
> Also solar panels that have a semi-linear fall-off, and transfer pumps and pipes that can handle an unlimited flow volume for zero power.

And magical control surfaces and wings?

Of course, to the Kerbals, that will be fixed in *Universe Patch 1.0.*

And kerbals treat the developers as divine gods, obviously.

> ![Rag5EB6.png](http://i.imgur.com/Rag5EB6.png)
